item.title: Derivation of Kalman smoother from an optimization perspective
item.description: In this post Kalman smoother formulas are derived as a solution to an optimization problem. Problem formulation Link to heading We consider an estimation problem for a discrete time linear stochastic system: $$ \begin{gather*} x_{k+1} = F_k x_k + G_k w_k \\ z_k = H_k x_k + v_k \\ \operatorname{E} x_0 = x_0^- \\ \operatorname{E} (x - x_0^-) (x - x_0^-)^T = P_0^- \succ 0 \\ \operatorname{E} w_k = 0 \\ \operatorname{E} w_k w_k^T = Q_k \succ 0 \\ \operatorname{E} v_k = 0 \\ \operatorname{E} v_k v_k^T = R_k \succ 0 \\ \operatorname{E} w_i w_j^T = 0 \text{ for } i \neq j \\ \operatorname{E} v_i v_j^T = 0 \text{ for } i \neq j \\ \operatorname{E} w_i v_j^T = 0 \\ \end{gather*} $$
